title: Kuoni sells Indian and Hong Kong travel businesses
text:
Save 
Kuoni has completed the disposal of its tour operating business by selling its remaining activities to the Canadian owner of Thomas Cook India for around £52 million. 
The sale follows that of Kuoni’s European tour operating arm, which was bought by German co-operative Rewe Group. 
Fairfax Financial Holdings through Thomas Cook India will take on all of the 1800 staff at the existing locations in India and Hong Kong and will continue to run the business activities. 
The Kuoni brand is licensed to the acquirer for one year in India and for five years in Hong Kong. 
“With the sale of the tour operating activities in India and Hong Kong, we have completed the sale of the outbound business as announced in January,” said Peter Meier, chief executive of Kuoni Group. 
“I’m very pleased that we found forward-looking solutions for all the units. The inclusion of the Indian Destination Management Specialists in the deal provided Kuoni Group an opportunity to conclude a timely transaction at attractive terms. 
“We expect the closing of all transactions in the course of 2015, allowing Kuoni to focus on the further development of its core business”
